content: Inland waterways, managed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, cover 25,000 miles and handle half of all inland waterway freight. The Corps maintains infrastructure like navigation channels, harbors, locks, and dams through dredging and water management. Maintenance and construction costs are funded by the Corps and the commercial user industry.
